intro: Lysimachia waianaeensis, commonly known as the Kauai goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Lysimachia waianaeensis is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the unique botanical diversity of Hawaiian flora.
